definition: medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: The site of the project is in an area zoned for medium density growth.
sentences.chinese: 该项目位于一个媒介稠密增长区。

sentences.english: At present, the television news review is situating in the media ecological environment.
sentences.chinese: 当前电视新闻评论正处于一个新的媒介生态环境中。

sentences.english: Conclusion Ixodes persulcatus was confirmed as Lyme disease vector.
sentences.chinese: 结论全沟硬蜱是吉林省莱姆病的主要媒介。

sentences.english: By Roderick Suganob As the medium of communication evolves, so is the marketing world.
sentences.chinese: “商业登记作为沟通媒介”的发展，因此是营销世界。
两种媒介各有各的生存空间。

sentences.english: Air is the media of the sound.
sentences.chinese: 空气是传播声音的媒介物。

sentences.english: Blandness in the basic politics of the media became standard.
sentences.chinese: 传播媒介在基本政治问题上通常采取温和的态度。

sentences.english: Signage system is the media of information communication between people and urban space.
sentences.chinese: 导视系统是城市空间信息传达的手段和媒介。

sentences.english: Without a doubt, the anthropological film and television is regarded as a transmission media.
sentences.chinese: 人类学影视片作为传播媒介，其属性是不存在争议的。

sentences.english: In fact, Yangjiang Group also used calligraphy as the medium of artistic practice.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，阳江组也是以书法为媒介来进行艺术实践的。

sentences.english: that uses fashion as a medium to bring awareness to social injustices.
sentences.chinese: 把时尚作为一种媒介让人们认识到社会不公平。

sentences.english: What tendency will be shown in the reproduction of medical disputes?
sentences.chinese: 在再现医疗纠纷的过程中将表现出怎样的媒介倾向。

sentences.english: It's the nature of software as a medium.
sentences.chinese: 它把软件的自然特性当作一种媒介。

sentences.english: To establish the public trust in media, news propagation must be banned.
sentences.chinese: 树立媒介公信力，必须遏制新闻炒作。

sentences.english: Love is an appetite of generation by the mediation of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是以种以美作媒介的生命繁衍的欲望。

sentences.english: Money is the meda of exchage.
sentences.chinese: 货币是商品交换的媒介。

definition: to borrow sth for another use/to borrow an idea for one's own use
to draw support from/with the help of
so as to/for the purpose of/in order to
